page.title: 15NASSINGTON BAND.
page.content: The Yarwell and Nassington Britannia Band was reformed in 1973 although there has been one in existence since 1860.They practice at Yarwell Village Hall every Wednesday evening.There are 22 musicians,10 of them children, playing many brass and percussion instruments.Their uniform is navy sweaters and jackets dark trousers or skirts.Members of the band come from Yarwell,Nassington,Woodnewton,Glinton, Peterborough,and Market Deeping.The band plays at local functions,fetes, festivals and flower shows,usually free of charge.The standard charge is 40 pounds for 90 minutes to 2 hours.They play any brass band music from hymns to pop songs,marches,dances and overtures.At the moment the band owns a full set of brass band instruments which would cost 25 000 pounds to replace at todays prices.
